intro: Erucaria ollivieri, commonly known as the African erucoid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Erucaria ollivieri is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
